name: Central Station Area Rezone
summary: Proposed zoning changes around Central Link Light Rail stations to allow higher density mixed-use development within a quarter-mile of station entrances. This proposal aims to maximize transit-oriented development opportunities and increase housing supply near high-capacity transit.

name: Citywide ADU Policy Update
summary: Proposed updates to accessory dwelling unit (ADU) regulations to allow two ADUs per single-family lot, remove owner-occupancy requirements, and reduce parking minimums. The goal is to expand gentle density options and provide more housing choices across Seattle neighborhoods.

name: Seattle Comprehensive Plan 2044
summary: Major update to Seattle's Comprehensive Plan setting land use and growth policies through 2044. Includes proposals for expanding urban villages, increasing allowed density in transit corridors, and updating neighborhood plans. This update is required under Washington State's Growth Management Act.

name: Ballard Link Extension Station Planning
summary: Early planning for zoning and land use around future Ballard Link Light Rail extension stations. Sound Transit's expansion will add new stations in Interbay, Smith Cove, and Ballard, requiring updates to local zoning to support transit-oriented development.

name: Industrial & Maritime Strategy Update
summary: Updated policies for Seattle's industrial and maritime zones to balance job preservation with flexibility for compatible uses. Includes provisions for limited residential development in designated areas while protecting core industrial lands.
